title: Slow Down First. That’s How Newsrooms Move Faster With AI.

title: Poynter and Hacks/Hackers partner to keep fast AI adoption aligned with journalism ethics

title: Major Publishers Lost 23% of Traffic After Blocking AI Bots, Though Smaller Sites May Face Different Tradeoffs
content: New research documents the complex effects of blocking AI crawlers, with the clearest evidence showing large publishers experienced significant traffic declines
creator: Hacks/Hackers AI

title: Forget “Google Zero.” We need to talk about “People Zero.”
content: “Publishers who thrive will offer experiences their audience simply can’t get from a generalized AI model.”
creator: Burt Herman

title: 2026 predictions, explaining AI paper, journalism jobs and more
content: Early bird tickets end soon for the 2026 AI x Journalism Summit

title: Journalism will stop relying on exposure to hold the powerful accountable
content: “For years, journalism relied on a simple chain of accountability: expose wrongdoing and someone would apply pressure…That mechanism no longer functions.”
creator: Paul Cheung

title: Google's New Benchmark Reveals Wide Gaps in AI Factual Accuracy — and Shows Search Tools Help
content: The best large language models get facts wrong about one-third of the time
creator: Hacks/Hackers AI
